metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14635 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - negligible
metadata.Description:
When using the Linux bridge ml2 driver, non-privileged tenants are able tocreate and attach ports without specifying an IP address, bypassing IPaddress validation. A potential denial of service could occur if an IPaddress, conflicting with existing guests or routers, is then assigned fromoutside of the allowed allocation pool. Versions of openstack-neutronbefore 13.0.0.0b2, 12.0.3 and 11.0.5 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-l3-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-metering-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-server - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
python3-neutron - 2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:13.0.0-0ubuntu4').
